atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: The @layer CSS at-rule is used to declare a cascade layer and can also be used to define the order of precedence in case of multiple cascade layers.

atDirectives.name: @container
atDirectives.description: The @container CSS at-rule is a conditional group rule that applies styles to a containment context. Style declarations are filtered by a condition and applied to the container if the condition is true. The condition is evaluated when the container changes size.

atDirectives.name: @starting-style
atDirectives.description: The @starting-style CSS at-rule is used to define starting values for properties set on an element that you want to transition from when the element receives its first style update, i.e. when an element is first displayed on a previously loaded page.
